senses.sense_definition: Pertaining to or organized into a trilogy (a set of three related works of art, such as novels or films).

examples.text: The author planned a <w>trilogical</w> structure for his fantasy epic to cover three distinct eras.
Critics praised the <w>trilogical</w> arrangement of the films, noting how well the stories connected.

senses.sense_definition: Having three parts, branches, or stages; tripartite.

examples.text: The philosopher proposed a <w>trilogical</w> division of the human soul into reason, spirit, and appetite.
We applied a <w>trilogical</w> model to the project, splitting the workflow into three parallel phases.
